title.narrative: COVID-19 Khartoum II - Response & Capacity Strengthening

description.narrative: 1. WASH-Health support to 9 Health facilities and population in the catchment areas. 2. Sustaining WASH services in selected vulnerable locations 3. Strengthening adherence of prevention practices through engaging the community and establishing a behavior change strategy

Access to communal latrines and hand hygiene stations for South Sudanese refugees and host communities are available in public places, such as mosques and community centers. However, most of the sanitation facilities are damaged and not properly equipped with water or soap posing a great risk of COVID-19 transmission, among other diseases. Similarly, some schools in the area have infrastructural problems, including lack of water tanks, damaged water pipelines, inadequate or blocked latrines, shortage of cleaning staff or insufficient budget to purchase PPEs and cleaning supplies.
South Sudanese population living in assembly points and host communities - 15,000 people.

The overall objective is to contribute to the prevention of COVID-19 and address the needs of the South Sudanese population and host community living in assembly points and host communities in Khartoum.

This proposal will focus in three localities: Jabal Awlya, Sharq El Nile and Um Badda. The three localities in Khartoum have been selected based on the number of South Sudanese refugees, the vulnerability of women and children in the assembly points, the severity of their needs and the irregular aid received from administrative authorities and humanitarian actors.
